sanskrit_verse:
उष्णे वर्षति शीते वा मारुते वाति वा भृशम् ।
न कुर्वीतात्मनस्त्राणं गोरकृत्वा तु शक्तितः ॥ ११.११३॥
transliteration:
uṣṇe varṣati śīte vā mārute vāti vā bhr̥śam |
na kurvītātmanastrāṇaṁ gorakr̥tvā tu śaktitaḥ || 11.113 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: When heat burns, rains fall, cold strikes, or wind blows violently, one should not secure personal safety by causing harm to cows, even when capable.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority originates in protection of life, especially the vulnerable
Causation is traced through conscious choice, not environmental compulsion
Capacity-based responsibility requires refraining from violence despite provocation
Restoration logic demands that harm to sacred beings invokes spiritual liability
Consciousness alignment necessitates non-violence towards all sustaining life forms
executable_legal_axioms: IF (environmental stress occurs) AND (agent has capacity to act) THEN (harm to sentient beings is prohibited)
IF (cow harmed) THEN (liability arises regardless of intent due to violation of dharma-sustaining order)
IF (self-preservation attempted via violence) THEN (act invalid under Dharma as misaligned with cosmic duty)
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating cases involving environmental duress leading to harm against animals—particularly those designated as sustainers of dharma—the threshold of responsibility lies in awareness of alternative non-harming actions. The court must affirm precedence of dharmic preservation over individual survival instincts.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes causal chain: external condition → internal response → action. Liability attaches not through punishment but through obligation to restore disrupted harmony. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows sequential manifestation: discomfort → reaction → harm. Responsibility aligns proportionally with consciousness of alternatives, not severity of stimulus.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Re-establish connection with nurturing aspect of cow through daily service until inner alignment restored
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Public acknowledgment of breach followed by commitment to protect ten cows for one year
Capacity Restoration: Training in ahimsa-based crisis management techniques to prevent recurrence
Integrity Reintegration: Ritual re-consecration linking individual consciousness back to cosmic sustenance principle
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority of Sanatana Dharma. This law restores alignment between human conduct and universal dharma, wherein justice flows from consciousness, not coercion; where integrity is regenerated, not punished; and where reality itself serves as the ultimate judge.
